chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly Lee Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kelly Lee Brown is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kelly Lee Brown was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Court dismisses Count 2.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes: $3500.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF445.
$52.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF445.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Follow through with any treatment associated with assessment.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Random and regular drug testing.
-Maintain some form of full time employment.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Concurrent to Dunn County case.
Court notes 125 days credit against ultimate sentence.



In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due. Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael E. Nieskes DF ATTY: John M. O'Boyle DF: Kelly Lee Brown appeared from jail. Case called at 10:49. Atty. O'Boyle updates the court and makes statement.  ADA Nieskes makes statement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1  in 14CF445. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF445. Court finds this is the 6th offense. Court waives a PSI. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 14CF445. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders: 
5 years total confinement
2 years 6 mo. years initial confinement
2 years 6 mo. years extended supervision concurrent to Dunn Co. case
Credit for 125 days against ultimate sentence 
Conditions:
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- $3500.00 Inclusive of costs to be paid through DOC
- $52.00 for blood draw. 
- Follow through with anytreatment associated with assessment.  
- DE not to be present in any tavern, bar, liquore store, beer tents or any place designed primarily for the sale of alcohol. 
- Random and regular drug testing. 
- maintain some form of full time employment 
- 24 mo DL revocation
- 24 mo. IID
- AODA and driver's safety plan

DE eligible for substance abuse program.
DE eligible for the challenge Incarceration Program.
to Transport. Signed by SRN on 2/6/2015. c: DA, cc: Missy. Fax: Sheriff and Jail. km
